items.title: Trump and Colombian President Trade Digital Attacks Over Boat Strikes
items.summary: President Gustavo Petro of Colombia accused the United States of murder in the death of a fisherman in a strike in the Caribbean last week.

items.title: Hit-and-Run at a Child’s Birthday Party Leaves 1 Dead, 13 Hurt
items.summary: The driver fled the scene after ramming a vehicle into a group of people, including children, outside a Maryland home Saturday night. He later turned himself in, the police said.

items.title: Trump Posts Fake A.I. Video of Himself Flying a ‘King Trump’ Jet Over Protesters
items.summary: President Trump shared what appeared to be an A.I.-generated video on social media. It shows Mr. Trump wearing a crown and flying a jet that dumps brown liquid on demonstrators.

items.title: Shutdown Fight Reopens Debate in G.O.P. Over Health Care
items.summary: The spending showdown has highlighted Republicans’ failure to produce an alternative to Obamacare, which many of them assail but concede is too politically risky to undo.

items.title: An ICE Raid at a Building in Chicago Swept Up Dozens of U.S. Citizens
items.summary: An immigration raid on an apartment building in Chicago followed years of problems with crime, and neglect by landlords. It swept up dozens of U.S. citizens who were detained in the middle of the night.

items.title: It’s 2025, and Democrats Are Still Running Against Trump
items.summary: In New Jersey, Virginia and beyond, voters have been inundated with ads linking Republican candidates to the president. Some Democratic strategists see a missed opportunity to forge a more positive message.

items.title: Trump calls Colombia president ‘illegal drug dealer’ as US says it hit another ship
items.summary: <p>Trump vows to cut US funding as Pete Hegseth says US hit Colombian rebel group vessel and ‘three terrorists killed’</p><p>Donald Trump on Sunday accused Colombia’s president, Gustavo Petro, of being an “illegal drug dealer” and threatened to immediately cut US funding to the country as the defense secretary confirmed in a social media post an attack on a vessel associated with a Colombian leftist rebel group.</p><p>Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Sunday that US forces had attacked another vessel, this time associated with a Colombian leftist rebel group. Hegseth, in a post on X, said “three terrorists were killed” in the operation which was “conducted in international waters”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/19/trump-colombia-gustavo-petro">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Portlanders mock Trump for calling their city ‘war-ravaged’. But they’re clear-eyed about its problems
items.summary: <p>Like many American cities, Portland has been struggling to combat rising unaffordability and homelessness</p><p>When Donald Trump said he was sending the national guard to Portland, Oregon, to protect immigration officers, local residents immediately responded with <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/03/portland-oregon-living-hell-tiktok-trump">characteristic sarcasm</a>. Mocking the president’s portrayal of a city in decline, social media was awash with videos of children in parks, busy farmers’ markets and September’s falling leaves overlaid with satirical text: “war ravaged”.</p><p>When the US secretary of homeland security, <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/07/kristi-noem-portland-ice-maga-influencers">Kristi Noem, visited</a> the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice) building where protesters had been gathering for weeks, she found a small crowd of demonstrators wearing inflatable animal costumes, not a city overrun by antifascist militants. The reality on the ground did not deter Trump from painting the city as unlivable.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/19/portland-oregon-residents-trump-housing-drugs">Continue reading...</a>
